knowledge_zone.heading: Situational Irony: Creates meaning in the text

sections.content: Situational Irony is used throughout the text to creates meaning in the text.

examples.quote: Little Chuck Little was another member of the population who didn't know where his next meal was coming from, but he was a born gentleman
examples.scene: Little Chuck helps Miss Caroline deal with Burris Ewell
examples.effect: Contradicts expectations about poverty and character, with child narrator innocently observing moral truth that dignity transcends economic circumstances

examples.quote: I chose to make my entrance
examples.scene: Scout arrives late to the pageant finale
examples.effect: Scout's embarrassing mistake at the pageant becomes trivial compared to the life-threatening attack that follows, revealing how perspective shifts with experience

pedagogy_zone.heading: From Device Spotting to Analysis
pedagogy_zone.intro_text: Most students can identify a device. Strong analysis shows what it DOES. Don't just label it—explain its function in creating meaning.

content.question: Ask yourself: Why does the author use Situational Irony HERE? What meaning does it create in this specific moment?
content.framework: Use TVODE: Technique → Verb → Observation → Device effect → Evaluation

pedagogy_zone.essay_application: In your essays, always connect device to meaning. Show HOW the technique creates the effect, don't just identify that it's there.

cta_zone.heading: Explore More Devices
cta_zone.intro_text: See how multiple devices work together to create the complete pattern.
